characters: I/E. ORLANDO'S CAR / HOSPITAL / EMERGENCY ROOM / REANIMAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORLANDO (57), in a steamy room lying on a bed bare-cheste in an old-fashioned sauna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando lying face down on a massage bed. A MASSEUR begin massage his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando already dressed, goes up the stairs and leaves th sauna. On the glass window of it, we can see a neon sign reads its name: “FINLANDIA”. He walks the streets of Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando sitting on his desk calls her secretary, they tal speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Monica... Have you seen a big white envelope that was sitting here on my desk?

dialogues.speaker: MONICA
dialogues.text: No, Sr. I haven~t seen it.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Thank you. He hangs up the phone. EXT. PARKING LOT - ORLANDO’S CAR -- DAY 5 Orlando looks for the envelope on the car’s glove box, no luck. He goes to the trunk of the car, goes through magaz and boxes, the envelope is not there. INT. HOTEL —- HALLWAY -- NIGHT 6 Orlando crosses the lobby of a middle-range hotel and hea to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Could I bother you for a piece of paper and an envelope?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Yes of course. Let me see... The receptionist gives Orlando a piece of paper and envel He writes something on it.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Great

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando on the elevator, he puts the envelope on the pock of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with people. On a small stage, a band playing Caribbean music. Orlando walks in as an attractive and electric young woma MARINA (27), sings a salsa song with grace and talent. There’s something strong and magnetic about her, A SLIGHT ROUGH FEMININITY... Is she a transsexual woman? No one at the bar is paying much attention to Marina’s performance, except for Orlando, who stares at her, fascinated and sings along softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando and Marina walk into a Chinese restaurant’s hyper decorated waiting lounge. A CHINESE RECEPTIONIST greets t at their arrival.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Good night.  10

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: I made a reservation for Orlando Onetto.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: One second. Yes, that~s right. Table 41.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BOY RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at a table, Orlando and Marina are with two Chine waiters standing besides them with a cake and sparkling candle, they sing happy birthday in Chinese. Marina laugh and blows the candle. The waiters and Orlando clap their hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you Orlando.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you! (to the waiter)

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE WAITERS
dialogues.text: I'll bring out some slices. The waiters leave.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you my love.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With a musical cake and everything! Orlando pulls the envelope out of the pocket jacket.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Here. Marina receives the envelope and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: How formal. “Valid for two airline tickets to the Iguazu Falls.” Orlando!

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: It's no small thing. It's one of the seven natural wonders of the world.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Oh wow! And when are we going?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: In ten days.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: In ten days... Marina stands up and walks to Orlando. She hughs him from behind and kiss him in the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, and why is it “valid for”?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: It’s a long story...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You haven~t bought them yet?  11 12 13

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Yes... I bought them and printed them out, and I put them in an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay, and?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: And I had them with me at the sauna.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: And I can’t remember where the fuck I put them.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Poor old man with senile dementia. They laugh and kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later they dance to a slow song and kiss. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT -- NIGHT 12 Orlando has a hard time getting his key in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: We're going to have to ask the doorman for some help. They are both a little drunk and tired, they laugh and Orlando finally manages to open the door. We hear the bar of a dog. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM -- NIGHT 13 It’s a large and elegant apartment, with view of the city Orlando and Marina make love in the dim light. They are p connection.  14 15 6. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- NIGHT 14 The silence in the room is suddenly interrupted by Orland gasping sounds. Marina turns the light on. Orlando is sitting up at his s of the bed with his back turned towards her, having difficulty breathing.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Orlando? Orlando tries to say something to her, but no words come

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Orlando, What’s wrong?!

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: I don’t know what’s wrong with me. Orlando stands up from the bed, tries to walk but falls d Marina runs to grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Orlando! What the fuck is going on? Come here. Marina manages to sit Orlando on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honey... What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina carries Orlando outside the apartment. He puts him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Lean against the wall. Look at me. Here. Marina puts Orlando’s glasses to him. She searches for something in her bag.  16

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The keys, do you have them?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: No... Marina search for the keys on Orlando’s shirt. No luck.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Orlando... She runs back to the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait here. No, Diabla, stop! Come here! Orlando stars walking with diffulty to the stair case. Th lights go out and he fells through the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Orlando? Marina sees him and runs through the staircase. DIABLA, t dog comes along and barks.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Orlando! Orlando, honey! Marina tries to put Orlando on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Let's go! INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- NIGHT 16 Marina drives nervously; the streets are empty. She notic that Orlando is in a lot of pain, unable to speak, in the passenger seat next to her. She looks forward again.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Honey, talk to me, ok? He doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Talk to me! Orlando! Please...  17 He barely reacts.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: To the hospital, Orlando, where else? Focus, okay? Orlando slips into unconsciousness once more, without eno energy to decide.

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ORLANDO
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Ok, Ok. He barely responds, and drives off at full speed.

dialogues.speaker: CUBICLE
dialogues.text: Marina brings the car to a screeching halt at a HOSPITAL entrance, honking her horn. She gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Help, please! One PARAMEDIC runs to the car.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Easy, ma’am. Let us take care of him... (TO ORLANDO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you OK? What’s your name? Can you hear me? (TO PARAMEDIC 2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Pablo, hurry up! Hurry! Two more paramedics arrive with a stretcher and try to pu Orlando out of the car; it’s a difficult task because his arms and legs are rigid and stuck in his seat. Orlando’s is HIT SEVERAL TIMES in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful... careful! Despite his limp state, they manage to pull him out of th car.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be careful. They drag him towards the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: What~s your name? What~s your name? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: His name is Orlando.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: (as they advance) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened!

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: What medication is he taking?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: None

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: How old is he?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Fifty-seven.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Hurry up, he’s not responding! Did he feel sick at some point?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: When he woke up... He had a headache, and he was acting strange.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: When was that?  18 10.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Like fifteen or twenty minutes ago. Marina anxiously watches how the nurses push Orlando into Reanimation cubicle. Impulsively, she follows them inside

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Male patient, 57 years old, loss of consciousness, his head is bleeding. Let's go. 1,2,3... Marina, standing motionless in one corner of the cubicle, observes how the paraemdics and nurses work. Due to the emergency, no one realizes that she has entere the reanimation cubicle and is still there, watching everything, looking disoriented. A FEMALE NURSE sees her draws closer.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: Ma’am, you have to wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I brought him here as fast as I could.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: Please, you have to wait outside. We'll take care of him, okay? Stay calm. Go, go... The Nurse pulls her out of the cubicle. Marina stares through the glass door how the paramedics t Orlando. She walks back and lean on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is left alone, standing in front of the cubicle’s by herself. She waits for several seconds... Until the NURSE appears with some of Orlando’s belongings

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: Are you a family member?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. I just brought him here.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: You don’t know him?  11.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, we're friends.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: (suspiciously) Oh. (rushed) These are his things. They can’t stay in there.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: How is he doing? (to the nurse)

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NURSE
dialogues.text: They’11 let you know. Just wait a little longer. The Female Nurse leaves, Marina waits for several tense seconds. Until a DOCTOR (60), projecting status and authority, emerges and faces her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (tactfully) Are you a member of Mr. Onetto’s family? Marina draws closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes The Doctor looks at her for a moment, scrutinizing her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Are you his partner?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, we’re partners. The Doctor raises the volume of his voice in order to dra her out of her state of shock.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Excuse me, your name is...?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Marina Vidal  19 20 12.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: But... that’s a nickname?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Could you come with me? So that we can speak in private...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Is something wrong? They begin walking through the hallway, they talk but we can’t hear what the doctor is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina enters the bathroom, she is alone. She breathes heavily and enters a bathroom cubicle. She fall off her knees, her head leans on the floor. The breathing gets lo and powerful. She washes her face and looks in the mirror. She can’t believe what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is calling GABO, the phone rings for several secon

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (into the phone, sounding sleepy) Orlando

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m Orlando’s friend.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Excuse me, who is this?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: This is Marina. I’m

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Yes, I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: The thing is, Orlando was feeling sick.  13.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: About an and a half hour ago. And I brought him to the hospital, but... uh...

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Which hospital?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Saint Thomas. He had a crisis in the car.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: And he died.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: He died?! Marina stutters. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes. Just now... I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m here. Have you called anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No, no one.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: But I need someone to come here. I can’t handle all of this.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Okay, don’t worry, I'll let the family know.  21 22 14.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Don’t call anyone. Ok?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: ok Gabo hands up. Marina looks around nervously; no one seem be watching her. She evaluates the situation. Slyly begin walk away, towards the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina begins to walk away from the hospital at a firm pa She'd rather avoid the conflict, and Gabo has already bee given notice... She begins to jog quickly. She advances a few blocks, but A patrol car pulls over and a POLICE OFFICER (30) comes d A light flashes over both of them.

dialogues.speaker: LOW-RANKING POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Miss Marina Vidal?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low-ranking police officer walks with Marina through hospital hallway. A CHIEF POLICE OFFICER and the doctor a waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: LOW-RANKING POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sargent

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Thank you

dialogues.speaker: LOW-RANKING POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Excuse me The low ranking police officer leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (to the doctor) You didn’t have to treat me like a criminal.  15.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (to the chief police officer) I’ll leave you to your work, excuse me. The doctor leaves.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (to Marina, firmly) Miss, I need your information.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Here? The Chief Police Officer has little patience.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Here. Full name

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Marina--

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Do you have an ID card with you? Marina returns his stare, then gives up and pulls her ID of her handbag. After looking at it, the Chief Police Off gazes at her severely.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: My new ID card is still pending, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Until you receive it, this is still your legal name.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: My name is Marina Vidal. Is there a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Why did you run off? Gabo arrives from behind. Marina doesn’t see him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Why am I being detained?  16.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You're not being detained, sir. Marina looks at him with a serious expression on her face

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Then why do you have my ID card?

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Good night. Marina turns and sees a scruffy, bald man with a potbelly waiting attentively a few meters away. It’s GABO (55), wh wearing an orthopedic boot.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marina? Thank you for everything. I’m sorry you had to go through all of this. I’m Gabo.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (nervous, remorseful) Hello Gabo.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: How are you? Gabo comes closer to greet her with a kiss on the cheek, hesitates, and finally greets her with a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. How are you? He then greets the Chief Police Officer, who is trying to figure them out.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gabriel Onetto, I’m the brother of the deceased. Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (gesturing towards Marina) No, everything is fine. He came brought him to the hospital and then wanted to leave in a hurry, but we needed to speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Well, you can speak to me. I’m his family, and I’m going to handle everything. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must understand that the lady here was with my brother when he died, so it’s a sensitive situation. The Chief police handles back Marina’s ID.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (to Marina) Your phone number, please. Humiliated, Marina dictates her phone number to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes... 98149575. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- DAY 23 Nervous, Marina drives Orlando’s car at considerable spee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina makes her way down a narrow hallway, between amuse park games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina already with her apron on. She is hitting on a punching game.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (off) Marina, we need you out here!

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m going. She makes a final strong punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina tries to function normally while she attend a coup of costumers. She carries a tray with used dishes.  18.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: CLIENT
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CLIENT
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could I have a glass of water?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, right away. ALESSANDRA (45), Marina’s strong and stylish boss, it’s i the bar writing something down. Marina approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: You didn’t want to come, and I was just calling you to ask if you could take the night shift. Crap.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I didn’t get to check my phone, Alessandra. The celebration was pretty intense.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: But you came. I appreciate that. Do you need anything?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No... Everything is fine.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Always so mysterious.  27 19.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: It’s been ringing for a while.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you. Marina takes the phone, she leaves the tray on a table an excuses herself from her colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pretending everything is fine) Hello She makes her way to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While she walks through the second floor and hallway tryi to look for a quite place to talk.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Hello? I’m Sonia. Orlando's wife. I mean, his ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I know. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: There’s no need for the formality. (silence) Look, I talked to Gabo, and he told me that you’re living in Orlando's apartment. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l be needing his car.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: You could have left the car with Gabo.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: He didn’t want it. Look ma'am... Look. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me when you need it and I can drop it off.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Let’s see... Tomorrow. Could you drop it off at my office tomorrow? I’1ll text you the address, and... You can leave it in the parking lot. You can ask there... And they’11 tell you where to park.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: At 10:30? Is that time OK?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’1l work it out.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Anything else of his that you might have?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. Just the intimate things.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (hurt, delirious) Well, we’ll have to work out what to do about the apartment. A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: I'd like for you to handle all practical affairs with me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: All right. Could we talk about that when we meet? I'm working right now.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is packed and Marina can barely keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: (from another table) Are you going to bring us our check, or not?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Right away.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Marina, someone’s looking for you outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: I Don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: At the entrance. Marina looks concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks towards the entrance. An attractive woman, ADRIANA (45), is standing waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: (holding a file in her hands ) Good afternoon, Marina. Thank you for coming out, this is just going to take two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hello

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Hello. I’m Detective Adriana Cortes, from the Investigations Police’s Sexual Offenses Unit. Good afternoon.  22. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Well first of all, I wanted to offer you my condolences. They told me what happened, and I’m really sorry. The fact that you run away from the hospital, gave me some reason for concern. Marina feels uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Could we talk over there?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Of course... They walk towards a more private place. They star walking

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I didn’t run away.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Oh. There must have been some confusion, then.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Could I see your identification, please?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Sure Adriana show it to her. She really is a police detective.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One question. Mr. Orlando...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Onetto.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Yes. Was he paying you?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (offended) We were a couple.  23.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: So you cared for each other. It wasn’t just sexual. Marina begins to feel irritated.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: It was a consensual relationship between two adults. Why do you want to know that?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Because he was old enough to be your father. (Marina holds back) Did you use drugs before his attack?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Alcohol?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Did you have sex?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I don’t remember. Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: I need to know if he suffered any kind of physical stress.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Nothing unusual.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: The thing is, Mr. Onetto’s body arrived to the hospital with injuries, with bruises. He had injuries on his arms, on his sides, on his neck. And a contusion to his head. Marina grows frightened. Adriana opens the file she has brought along with her and shows it to Marina.  24. There are pictures inside. Marina looks at them, then sna it shut, affected.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I talked to the doctor about all of this. Did you talk to his family? Marina is confused. Alessandra appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Marina! Excuse me... We’re having problems with the check for table 15.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m coming.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Five minutes, please. (to Alessandra) Alessandra goes back inside. Adriana fixes her gaze on Marina. Can't anyone fill in for you? (to Marina)

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. And I really need to get back to work... Or they’1l fire me.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Look, I’ve been working on the streets for 23 years. 14 years on the Sexual Offenses Unit. I have a Master’s degree on the subject. I know very well what happens with people... Sorry, with women like you. Because I’ve seen it all. All. Adriana carries on in her sensitive, condescending tone.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to know that I understand and support you. Did you have to defend yourself from him?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Am I being arrested?  25.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Then I’m leaving, because I really... Adriana try to grab Marina’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Wait, let’s do something. (handing her a card) Call me when you’re done here so we can talk properly. So that I can sleep tonight, okay? Marina head back, Adriana follows her.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Talk about what?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: I‘1l be waiting for your call. Marina is forced to nod her head. She puts the card away.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it’s best if you don’t leave Santiago. (walking towards the restaurant)

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay, goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina returns to the dining room as Adriana leaves, tryi to look normal.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Marina. (to Alessandra) Thank you, the place looks great!

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Thank you. Marina and Alessandra watch her leave.  30 31 32 26.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, everything okay.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: I tried to rescue you, did you notice?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes, I noticed, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Are you telling me what the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Can it be some another time? I've had a terrible day.

dialogues.speaker: ALESSANDRA
dialogues.text: Sure. Alessandra nods, and Marina returns to her hectic job. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR -- AFTERNOON 30 Marina, tired and humiliated, is driving Orlando’s car. S arrives to the apartment and parks the car. Everything is silence, she sees the ghost of Orlando. Her breathing bec heavy. She grabs from the floor a key with the number 181 written on it, her hands tremble. She gets down from the and whispers a song while he walks through the parking lo INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM -- AFTERNOON 31 Marina continues whispering “Spossa” while she walks thro the apartment and collapses on the couch. Diabla approach and seats with her.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Diabla! Hi to you. INT. ORLANDO’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM -- NIGHT 32 Marina looks very tired, she is on her pyjamas. She liste to a voicemail Adriana left on her cell phone.  33 34 27.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: (on the phone, in a serene tone) Marina, this is Detective Cortes speaking. I imagine you must have a good reason for standing up an Investigations officer. Now, I’m not going to ask, I’m going to demand that you come in and talk to me tomorrow. I'll be at the Forensic Medical Service, look for me when you get there, I’ll see you at 12:30. Don’t call me. No excuses. I’m not interested. Oh, and please don’t make me send someone to pick you up. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- NIGHT 33 Marina pretends to be boxing as she did earlier that day. She opens Orlando’s closet and immerse her head between h cloths. She lays face up on the bed, lights a joint and smoke. Sh tries to relax her self through her breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day has broken, and Marina opens her eyes. Diabla barking wakes her up. She hears a masculine voice inside the apartment. BRUNO (29) its in the hallway playing with Dia Marina seems really surprise and upset.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Are you Marisa?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Marina

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: I’m Bruno. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I thought there was no one here. Bruno walks toward the living room and Marina puts a swea on. She goes to the leaving room to meet with Bruno.  28.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened, Marisa?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Your dad suddenly started feeling sick. Everything happened really fast.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: What were you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: (affected) And that’s all? You were with him and, he died? Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: We ran to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: His body was bruised. Why the fuck was his body bruised? An injury to his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (affected) He felt down the stairs when we were going down. That’s why. Bruno notices the unopened boxes and suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: What about those suitcases?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I was moving in.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Shit. Bruno gets down to pat Diabla.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with you, Diabla?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Orlando gave her to me. I’m sorry.  29.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: He gave you Diabla? That really sucks. Bruno stands up and walks through the apartment, he sits the leaving room. Marina stays standing.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look... I slept with this dog for years. But I had to stop doing it. I didn’t like the smell. Did you know that there are two kinds of people with pets? Those who have mammals, and those who prefer birds or reptiles. Mammals, we have a neocortex. The most developed layer of neural tissue, Where emotions are generated. That’s where empathy, tenderness... ...and love are generated.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (upset) I don’t see anyone with a lizard around here. I don't get you analysis. Or are you trying to say something else?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: I°m not trying to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Aha.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Have you gotten the operation?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You can’t ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: And why not? I dont understand what are you!

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m the same as you.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure... (laughing)  30.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (begging to leave the leaving room) Look, can we talk some other time? I really...

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: (he stands up) Wait, wait... I just need to know when you’re moving out of this apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I‘1l let you know as soon as I find something.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: How much time are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: A few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: (he turns violent) No, not a few weeks. Give me an exact date or I'll kick you out. Marina faces him defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You know what? Go away from my house.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: This isn’t your house. Marina walks to the entrance and Bruno chases her. He gra her against the wall, Marina breathes heavily and Bruno stares really close to her face.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Incredible. My dad was crazy. He let go of Marina and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you steal anything, I’11l know.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hey Bruno! My name is Marina. Bye. Marina slams the door behind Bruno.  35 36 37 31. INT. ORLANDO'S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM -- DAY 35 Marina wears a blue jeans dress, she stare at the mirror. grabs her purse that is on top of the bed, she sees again key with the 181 number written on it. INT. ORLANDO’S CAR - CARWASH -- DAY 36 Marina’s car enters the carwash tunnel. The running water the dryers... It’s the closest thing she’s had to a peace moment. Protected in this solitary space, Marina lets her head fall back and closes her eyes. She sings quietly. As the soap falls over the windshield, Marina looks back through the rearview mirror: ORLANDO IS SITTING IN THE BACKSEAT. The spinning brushes run over the windows, making the car dark. Marina can’t tear her eyes away from Orlando throug the rearview mirror; his face is hidden in the moving sha and lights. Orlando now turns around and looks directly at her. Is sh losing her mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overwhelmed, Marina covers her face with her hands as she waits in line for the cash register. She fails to realize that it’s her turn.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Miss...? Miss? Marina snaps back. She advances.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’ve got to pay for the wash. The CASHIER (30) takes a look at her exhausted, upset demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: You need a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (staring back at her) Ok, one expresso.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: How would you like it?  38 39 32.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Double.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. ORLANDO'S CAR / URBAN HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Marina drives the now spotless car down a highway. Anothe cathartic song is playing on the radio, at full volume. “Natural Woman” performed by Aretha Franklin. Marina turn onto a busy street. It’s an office buildings area. A DOOR receives her, she pull down the window.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hi, good morning.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Hi, good morning.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m bringing this car to Sonia... I don*t know her last name.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, Sonia Bunster. Yes, she told me to inform her about your arriving. Please park in the -4th floor, parking space number 5. She'll come and pick up the car.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: She wants me to wait down there?

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s what she told me.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Ok, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: You’re welcome, go ahead. Marina continue driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked. Marina waits besides it for SONIA (48) come down. sees a woman making gestures at her from the sidewalk. It SONIA (48), attractive, with panache, dressed formally. T size each other up in a glance.  33.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Hello

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hello, Sonia. Sonia stares back at her, unable to react.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. They shake hands. But Sonia is still stupefied. Marina responds with a gesture: this is me. SONIA (CONT’D) I've been wondering how is your face for about a year, It's different like this, face to face.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Of course. Sonia still can’t believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you can see... bones and flesh.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s just that... I can’t imagine Orlando being with you. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Oh. Ok.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Don't treat me so formal.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Eh... Here are the car keys. Sonia receives them.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: The documents are in the glove compartment.  34.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Ok. Excuse me. (lamenting herself, whispering) Pure quantum physics. Sonia checks inside the car, then emerges and opens the trunk: it’s filled with color samples, books, and other products from Orlando’s printing press. Sonia slams the trunk shut, places both hands on the car, lowers her head. It truly is a difficult moment for her.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (without looking at her) I don’t want to talk about the apartment right now. Just move out as quickly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you. (sincerely) Sonia, I’m so sorry about how things turned out.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (looking up at her now, hurt) Are you sorry for the whole soap opera, or for this episode in particular?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: For the way in which things happened. A look of frustration grows over Sonia’s face. She needs express what she’s feeling.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Look, I was 38 years old when I married Orlando. We were together for 9. We were a completely normal couple. We had a normal life... (recalling, painfully) So when he came and explained to me... I... So then I thought that... I’m sorry if it sounds crude and direct of me to say this, but I really think that this is... just perversion.  35. Marina feels loathing and compassion towards her at the s time.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but... It’s that when I look you, I don’t know what I’m looking at. Pause. Sonia knows that she’s crossing a line. SONIA (CONT’D) A chimera, that’s what I see.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: A chimera... Ok. Marina is taken aback by the sentence.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Both are completely engrossed by each other.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: There’s no need to be sorry. You’re normal. You're fine. Marina begins to walk away. Sonia follows here to the elevator. A MAN IN A GREY SUITE is standing there waiting the elevator to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A GREY SUIT
dialogues.text: Hi

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hi

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A GREY SUIT
dialogues.text: Hi Sonia

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Hi Pablo. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A GREY SUIT
dialogues.text: Im fine and you?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Fine. Thank you

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN A GREY SUIT
dialogues.text: Good. The elevator arrives and the three of them jump in.  40 4l 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina, Man in a Grey Suit and Sonia are experience a awk moment on the elevator. Nobody speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina exits the elevator and Sonia follows here behind.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (severely) Is it clear to you that my 7 year old daughter will be at the wake this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes. And I would love to know where it’s being held. I know how to be discreet. Sonia is shocked by the fact that Marina is even consider the idea of attending.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: But don’t even think about going.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I have the right to say goodbye to him, too. Sonia tries not to lose control.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Look, it’s my problem now. You already went through a hard time. Now all the paperwork is up to me. And in fact, I’d like to compensate you for everything that you've done. Really, so that you can be at ease. You don’t need to go anywhere, or do anything else. And we're going to handle this ina civilized way, so we can both be satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I don’t need your money, ma’am. Did you call Investigations Police?  42 43 37. Marina is unable to read her.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: No. Well, in any case, I apologize. I’m just looking out for my love ones. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Orlando was a loved one to me.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Yes, but you aren't coming to the funeral. Or the wake. Do you understand? I don't know how to explain it to you. What you want me to say? Daniel. You are not going to the funeral... Or any place. Marina can’t believe it. Marina looks at her fearlessly. Sonia needs to be sure. She gathers strength in order to herself clear. SONIA (CONT’D) Please... Let us live this mourning as a family. As it’s supposed to be. Do not show up. I’m asking you as a mother. Just think that there’s an entire family, devastated. In shock. Sonia walks always and gets in the elevator. SONIA (CONT’D) I would give a lung for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is on the bus. A brief pause in this battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina and Adriana are standing at the entrance of the Institute.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Adriana, I wanted to apologize for not calling... Adriana is carrying her file with her.  38.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Detective Cortes.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Detective. I wanted to apologize for not calling you last night, but I was overwhelmed. I took some sleeping pills.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: (interrupting) It’s all right. She walks inside the building. Marina follows her.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This way, please.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Are we going to see Orlando’s body?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: No. I asked for a room and if I'm late, I'll be in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: The thing is, since you didn't call me yesterday... Well, I went over our conversation. The toxicology exam came back with positive results for alcohol... and marihuana. Marina starts to worry.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: We're giving you a physical inspection. Marina stops in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. No way.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It’s superficial.  39.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: But you never told me--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Look. I went to check on you yesterday, I was worried. I gave you an opportunity to tell the truth and you lied to me. Then, you failed to keep your promise and left me waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Again, I apologize for not calling you yesterday. That sleeping pill... I’m sorry. About that other thing...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Look, what I need is to confirm that you don't have any injures.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: But I don’t have any injures.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Then there shouldn’t be a problem. Adriana walks the stairs. Marina stops walking. Adriana t around.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What? Why are you doing this to me?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Because it's what corresponds. It’s called a possible injuries observation.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Well, I refuse. Adriana stops.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: (firmly) Fine, I’1l file for a formal request from the district attorney, and that implies opening a file on Orlando Onetto’s death. Marina looks at her, enraged.  44 40.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, if you don't have anything, this ends here. You go on with your life. You decide. Marina knows that she’s caught. She doesn’t respond. INT. FORENSIC MEDICINE INSTITUTE - DOCTOR’S OFFICE -- DAY The DOCTOR respectfully closes the door for Marina to tak her cloths of.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm going to close this... So you'll be comfortable. While Marina undresses behind a screen, the Doctor and Adriana make small talk in a low tone of voice. Marina listens to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help. You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: We're even now.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You told me that her name was Daniel? What should I call her?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: Don’t call her Daniel. Treat her like a woman. Ask her what her name is... but call her by her woman's name.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: What did she do?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know, that's why we are here.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: But is she involved in something complicated? Adriana and the doctor realize Marina is hearing the conversation. Marina slips into the gown and emerges.The doctor approaches Marina and guides her through the room.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ok. This way, please. What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Marina

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: That's a pretty name, Marina. Could you stand there, please? Thank you. The doctor guides Marina and puts her in front of the wal He opens a drawer and pulls out a camera.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marina, right? Marina. Please, could you... could you uncover your chest? Marina complies. Her wide shoulders, her long hair, and h flat, hairless chest are all exposed. The Paramedic takes picture of her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This will be really quick, okay? Here I go. That’s it. Now please raise your right arm. A little higher. Yes. There. The same with the other arm, please. (he takes another picture) Have you received any kind of aggression... Blows, have you fallen, anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Ok. (He doesn’t show so convinced) Well, now I’m going to ask you to uncover your lower part. (to Adriana) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you please leave us so that...?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Could you uncover your lower half? We’re almost done, Marina. Marina notices that Adriana doesn’t take her eyes off of Resigned, she removes the hospital gown completely and st there, naked. The doctor takes another picture.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could you please raise your right leg, Marina? To the side? There, there. She complies, shocked by what she’s being required to do. last flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A humiliated Marina walks through the hallway of the Fore Medical Services. She heads out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is riding a bus. It is packed with people, most of them standing and holding onto a rail. She processes her thoughts. It’s been too much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks through the park while he talks with Gabo on cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Marina. This is Gabo. I'm sorry to bother you. Look... We’re going to incinerate Orlando. It’s what he wanted. And although Sonia doesn't know yet... ...to be clear, this is my own initiative. I wanted to offer you...  48 43.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Some of his ashes. Marina can’t believe what she’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you, but no.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's just that I feel that you deserve them. Really.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: In exchange for not showing up, Gabo?

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’d love for you to come. But...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I'm eating right now.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't want to interrupt you.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Gabo, I’m hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hold on a second, we haven’t agreed on... Marina leaves Gabo talking and hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks down the long hallway of an elegant building gathering her strength. She arrives at a door and knocks. Someone opens.  49 50

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you for having me. I need it. She enters. The door closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina gets off the elevator, takes a deep breath and kno the door. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come in. INT. SINGING COACH’S APARTMENT -- DAY 50 Marina drinks coffee, as her SINGING COACH (65), grumpy a walking with some difficulty, takes his seat at a piano.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: Fucking gout.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I can't believe that even your illnesses are corny.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: You look awful.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You're not wearing your glasses. You can't see me from there. He puts on his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: You look... Awful. Their closeness can be felt. He senses that she is unstab SINGING COACH (CONT’D) Did you come here to improve your technique, or to hide from the world for a while?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (knowing what’s coming next) Um... Both... and vice-versa.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: I have no problem with you coming here too little or too late... or whenever you need a little moral support. But I’m your coach... lyrical singing. Not salsa, or Merengue. Lyrical singing. Marina interrupts him. She knows that he’s right. And she repeats something that we can sense they’ve talked over several times.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: And you're not my psychologist, and you're not my father.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What did I come for, then?

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: To sing I hope.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: To look for some love, maybe. Having delivered his message, the Coach changes his tone, laughs at his own paternalistic attitude.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: (he nods his head) You can~t look for love.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. Not Saint Francis again, please.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING COACH
dialogues.text: (Lauhgs ) Saint Francis doesn’t say. “Give me love, give me peace, give me light, give me this, give me that.” Saint Francis says, “make me an instrument of your love, make me a channel of your peace.” Marina draws closer to him. She plants a quick kiss on hi forehead. A sign of an old friendship. SINGING COACH (CONT’D) Sing a little bit for me.  51 52 53 54 46. He plays Spossa son Dispraseta on the piano, and Marina starts off with her vocal exercise. Once more, her voice moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Marina singing Spossa son Dispraseta. She walks t street alone, its really windy. As the seconds passes, th wind grows stronger and carries all kind of dust. At some point this natural force becomes so strong Marina can’t continue walking, the wind stops her. EXT. ORLANDO’S BUILDING - ELEVATOR -- DAY 52 Marina alone on the elevator, her mind is elsewhere. She looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina steps into the apartment. Her closed suitcases... stops when she notices an anomaly: Cigarettes, pizzas and beer on the table of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Diabla! She looks for Diabla but doesn't find it. Marina pack her suitcases and leave the apartment. While she heads out, s makes a final call.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Onetto Textiles. Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I have a wreath for Orlando Onetto. Could you tell me where is the wake is being held? EXT. ORLANDO’S BUILDING -- DAY 54 Marina waits on the sidewalk, next to her suitcases. GASTON (39) and WANDA pulls up in front of her in his car Gast6n hugs Marina.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Take it easy, pretty.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay.  47.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Is this all you're stealing?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: If you had a bigger car, I could steal more.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: What? You two sisters are starting already? Gaston begins to load her things into the trunk. Wanda hu Marina.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: You'll scare me to death.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No. I’1l survive. 55 INT. GASTON AND WANDA’S CAR -- DAY 55 Marina rides in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: (breaking the ice) I think we should call the police.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Because it’s a crime. Strictly speaking, it’s trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No, I don't want any more police... No more doctors, no more hospital gowns, no more uniforms... I don't want anything. It was Orlando's son. He wants me out of there, fast. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: That’s not the point. It’s no way to communicate.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Oh please, Mr. Contradictions. “That's not the point”. Stay out of it!  48.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: What do you mean, stay out of it? For over 9 years, I’ve been hearing the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m getting out of your house as soon as I can, okay?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: No, it’s not that. Our house is your house, always. (to Gastén) Always, right?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Yes, always.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Can I ask you for one last favor?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Another one?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: (to Gastén) Cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Could you drop me off here, please? The couple exchanges a worried glance. Gaston drives on.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I want my dog.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: I don't think it’s a good idea for you to do anything by yourself.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: No. Let’s wait until we get home. There, we can smoke something. We can relax, and then you can make a more mature decision.  56 57

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: A red light. The car comes to a stop. Marina climbs out a run away from the car. Wanda and Gaston call her out.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Marina!

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Marina! Climb out!

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Why don't you climb out?!

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Because I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Okay... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is riding the bus, indignantly. She looks angry an decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina opens the door and enters the chapel where Orlando funeral is being held. She sees Sonia, Gabo and Bruno sit up front, close to the casket. Two TWENTY-YEAR-OLDS are singing a song, accompanied by a guitar. They discover he presence. The people inside the chapel, begin to mutter amongst themselves and turn around to look at Marina. Outraged, Sonia STANDS UP NOISILY, attracting everyone’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: (shouting, very imposing)

dialogues.speaker: NO ONE HERE SAYS ANYTHING
dialogues.text: ORLANDO’S DAUGHTER Mom! Everyone in the chapel freezes. The twenty-year-olds stop singing. Everyone’s eyes are on Marina, who wishes she co run out of there. A small girl --Orlando’s daughter?-- br into hopeless sobs.  58 59 50. Marina, affected by the girl’s sobbing, chooses not to in and begins to make her way towards the exit. The sounds o her clicking heels echo loudly throughout the chapel. A w encounters her at the door and throw her out of the chape

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Don't you have any respect for others people pain? Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks towards the street, crossing the chapel’s fr yard without looking back. Gabo appears, trying to catch up with her, but with littl success due to his orthopedic boot.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: (honestly) Marina... Marina, I apologize. She doesn’t respond or stop walking.

dialogues.speaker: GABO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone is a little upset. It’s nothing personal. Marina stops and confronts him.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Saying goodbye to a loved one when he dies is a basic human right.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: I think you’re completely right.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: It’s done, Gabo. Go back inside. Make sure you don’t fall. She kisses him and leaves him behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is already a couple of blocks away from the chapel continuing to walk away. A pickup truck begins to follow her, advancing at her sam speed.  51. Marina grows unsettled, and she looks at it: Bruno is driving, a MAN (40) is riding beside him, and a YOUNG MAN (24) is in the backseat. Marina looks away and keeps on walking. It’s better to av conflict... She looks again.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Why did you come to disturb the family?! Marina holds back. Marina exchanges a short glance with Bruno, who is just a scared as she is.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were told over and over again to leave us alone.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What do you want? Marina quickens her pace, accumulating rage. She tells herself over and over again that it’s best to avoid confl She looks at the Man.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: We want you to get out of here, you fucking faggot. What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You're looking at me. Marina holds back...

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me faggot?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Go destroy families somewhere else. You fucking monster! Hey! You Fucking faggot. Stop the car! Stop! You mother fucker! Marina keeps on walking, blinded with rage. The truck sto The Man, the Young Man and Bruno climb out and violently her. Marina tries to skirt them.  60 52.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Let go of me, you coward! Let go of me! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You drive. (to Bruno)

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You Fucking cowards! What do you want?! They struggle clumsily for a few seconds, and the two men up dragging Marina to the truck and pulling her into the backseat. The doors slam shut... The truck takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is sitting in the backseat, between the Man and th Young Man.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Where is my dog? What did you do to my dog, you coward?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: That~s not your house. They pin her arms down, hard. Marina fights back.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: If you liked my dress so much, you could have taken it, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: The mother fucker uses dresses!

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Did you cut your dick off? Did you put it away?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Close your snout, it smells like shit!  53.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: You think you’re Julia Roberts, you piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You wear a dress with those football player legs? Bruno looks uncomfortable with the situation.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You have no right to touch me! Do you think your dad would be proud of what you’re doing to me?! He would slap you if he saw you! The Young Man pulls a roll of TAPE out from his backpack, together with the Man’s help wrap some tape around Marina head, covering her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Here’s your slap.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have sent the police!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What police?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Let go of me! More tape is wrapped around her head, closing one of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I can't hear you!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Now talk, you motherfucker!  61 62 63 64 65 54.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Talk! You piece of shit! Bruno turns around, he doesn’t like where the situation h come to. Marina’s face is now deformed. Bruno keeps on driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup truck pulls over at a street downtown. The backseat door opens and the Man climbs out. He pulls Marina out of the vehicle and gives her a push.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I hope it~s clear now! The Man climbs back into the truck and it takes off at fu speed. Marina sits, she is in pain. She gets up and starts walki She draws closer to a parked car and sees her deformed fa reflected in a window. She cuts through the tape, ashamed crushed. She keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks aimlessly through downtown Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina arrives at the doors of a nightclub. She enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina dances, exorcizing with a STRANGER, they kiss on t mouth. They crosses the dance floor, waling drunkenly amo the crowd. The music explodes, the people begins to move frenzy. Marina and he Stranger are kissing on a corner of nightclub. She goes down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina, now without the Stranger, walks to the dance floo She is completely lost and sees Orlando staring at her fr the bar.  66 67 68 69 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She discovers that ORLANDO IS STILL WATCHING HER, standin the dance floor, camouflaged in the crowd. Marina begins to dance with even greater impetus, as anonymous hands rise and surround her, cheering her on, w then turns into... A LONG AND COORDINATED GROUP CHOREOGRAPHY, vehement and openly sexual. INT. WANDA’S APARTMENT - HALLWAY -- NIGHT 67 Marina knocks on Wanda’s entrance door, she looks tired a she is completely wet. Gaston opens it.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: (patiently) Hello, Marina.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hello, Gaston. He lets her in. INT. WANDA’S APARTMENT - SOFA/ LIVING ROOM -- DAWN 68 Marina is laying back on a sofa. She’s already awake, not feeling good. INT. WANDA’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN -- MORNING 69 Marina and the family drink coffee together in the kitche Wanda looks for something in the newspaper. Wanda reads Orlando’s funeral information in the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Here it is. Orlando Onetto Pertier.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: We announce the passing of our husband, father, partner and friend. Orlando Onetto Pertier. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funeral services shall be held today at 16:30 at Parque de la Paz cemetery. Ejército Avenue #315, Santiago. His wife, brother, and children...”

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: (trying to change the subjet) Could you pass the avocado? The sisters seem not to listen.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Wait, listen... “We are deeply saddened to announce the passing of Orlando Onetto Pertier..." blah blah blah... Onetto Textiles employees.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: What’s the point? I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I'm reading.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: What for? (to marina) Don*t go. That would be masochism.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Define to me what masochism is.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: People who like to suffer. Do you like to suffer?

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: I don*t like to suffer...  70 71 72 57.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: I’m just reading to my sister...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Ok, stop it! Really, stop! I'm not going anywhere. Okay? I’ve turned the page. Okay? Life goes on. They seem not yo pay attention on what Marina just said.

dialogues.speaker: WANDA
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me what to do?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: No, no...

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (talking to herself) What doesn't kill you, make you stronger. Stronger. Marina’s mind is a million miles away, as she plays with “181” key on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is sitting while her hair is being washed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina it’s getting her nails done.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I have the hands of an orangutan.

dialogues.speaker: MANICURIST
dialogues.text: No, you don’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina, completely renovated, walks and runs head on into Workers carrying A LARGE MIRROR. She's struck by her own image in the reflection: is that  73 74 75 58. The Workers continue on their way, unblocking a flashing sign with an arrow in front of her: BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is almost deserted, and it has an unreal air to Marina takes a large sip of her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina looks calmer, she walks the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina hands an OLDER MAN (60) his check.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: (charming) How much is it, darling?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (handing him the check) Here you go. The Older Man searches for his money, but he can’t find a in his wallet or in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: I’m losing everything lately. Do you think it’s because of my age? Marina smiles at him. The Older Man begins to pull everyt out of his pockets: his cellphone, some cigarettes, keys. finally finds some cash.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we are. Marina takes the cash, but she can’t take her eyes off of of the objects that the Older Man has set upon the table.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. What’s that? Marina points to a set of keys, one of which is a small k that looks EXACTLY like the “181” key.  76 77 78 79 59.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: It’s the key to my sauna. Marina hides her amazement. The Waitress Friend observes this, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: To your sauna?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: (smiling) It’s the key to my locker at the sauna just around the corner, the “Finlandia”. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: It just caught my attention. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks out the restaurant, decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks one block, two blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina stops on the sidewalk across the street from an ol sauna. The building’s facade has a neon sign that reads: “FINLANDIA”. She crosses the street and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina draws closer to the RECEPTIONIST (45), who is concentrated on her papers.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Is it co-ed? The Receptionist nods, barely looking up at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But are the saunas separated downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (sanctimoniously) Of course.  80 81 82 60. Marina sees another set of keys that look just like “181” her desk.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: How much is it? The Receptionist hands her a price list. Marina pays and heads downstairs quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ladies’ changing room, Marina takes her dress off. see her chest. She puts a towel on and looks for the key inside her purse. She emerges out into the hallway, trying to understand th place’s logic. She advances... and instead of entering the women’s steam bath, she enters the men’s area, carrying the key in her hand. INT. SAUNA - HALLWAY / MEN’S AREA -- DAY 81 Marina makes her way across the men’s dark and steamy sau She searches with her eyes, hidden in the darkness: she s a thin, naked man rinsing himself off with a hose, and a sauna employee.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Where can I find the locker?

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina enters the locker hallway and searches for the num She finally finds and stands before locker 181. Marina ma a decision and slides the key in the lock. IT’S THE RIGHT KEY. She opens the locker and discovers what’s inside... NOTHING. She observes the empty contents for a few seconds, defeat  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina runs through the streets. She pulls a taxi over an jumps in. A man is in there.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Get out, Sir, I have an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: MAN ON TAXI
dialogues.text: I have an emergency too.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (screaming) Get out! The man gets out.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nicer again) Take Alameda St. please sir. Marina rides on the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks through the cemetery parking lot, amongst ca that are already on their way out. A car approaches her from behind, honking: Bruno is drivi Sonia is sitting beside him, and Gabo is in the backseat. Bruno stops the car suddenly when he sees her. She turns around and stands stiff.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Marina. What the fuck are you doing here!

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: The Ceremony is over, go home!

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: Could you please leave us in peace!

dialogues.speaker: SONIA
dialogues.text: Move, move! Crazy man! Move!

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: Sonia, she is a woman.  85 86 62.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: She is not a woman. Marina continues standing, she doesn’t pretend to move.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move! Move! Made-up faggot! Marina impulsively puts one foot on the rear bumper and J ONTO THE CAR’S TRUNK, THEN WALKS ONTO THE ROOF AND VIOLEN JUMPS UP AND DOWN ON IT.

dialogues.speaker: GABO
dialogues.text: No, Marina, please don't do that!

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: I want! My! Dog! She then springs forward, letting herself fall onto the windshield, beating on it with the palms of her hands. Marina slides off of the car deftly. Sonia screams while Bruno and Gabo observe this, frozen. Marina walks to Bruno’s window.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you have Orlando’s keys... She throws them inside. The car leaves. Marina is left on own in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina walks and arrives at the cinerary building, which looks like a small chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina enters the cinerary. It’s completely empty, except a CLEANING LADY who is putting out a bunch of candles.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Is this where Orlando Onetto’s ceremony was held?

dialogues.speaker: CLEANING LADY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just clean here.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Might you know where is he?  87 88 89 90 63.

dialogues.speaker: CLEANING LADY
dialogues.text: No idea, m'am Marina leaves this impersonal place, looking frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina observes the empty gardens... She looks defeated. Marina is taken aback when she feels someone passing clos by... It’s ORLANDO, who is already walking towards the ba of the cinerary building. She follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina follows Orlando down a car ramp that leads to an underground level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando enters an underground hallway. Marina follows him She takes a look around: piled up caskets, candle stumps, heap of wilting flowers, broken statues... ORLANDO pushes her up against the wall behind her. Marina tries to push him away in terrified silence, but Orlando corners and kisses her. But after a while, she gives in to a long and heartfelt k Orlando takes a few steps back. Marina, panting, brings o hand up to her mouth. Orlando enters through a metallic g She follows him and tires to open the door, its closed. Marina dispairs.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: (shouting) Open up!! The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina enters the incineration room, artless and technolo Two EMPLOYEES are with Orlando’s body on top of a metalli sheet.  91 92 93 94 95 96 64.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Thank you. The EMPLOYEES leave and Marina walks to Orlando. He is wi black suite. Marina holds his hand, she cries. One of the EMPLOYEES comes back again. He enters the meta sheet on the dark cavity. The window closes and Marina, undaunted, watches as Orlando’s body is disintegrated in fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina dressed sport. She runs together with Diabla. INT. MARINA’S NEW APARTMENT - BEDROOM -- NIGHT 92 Marina is naked on top of her bed. Diabla lies with her. has a little circular mirror on top of her legs that cove her sex area. The mirror reflects her face. INT. MARINA’S NEW APARTMENT - KITCHEN -- NIGHT 93 Marina, all fixed up to go out, leaves Diabla with some f on it’s plate.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Bye, Diabla. She leaves the apartment and gives a boxing hit to a puch ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is riding in the taxi, looking fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters in an elegant theater. She walks downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marina is backstage in this sophisticated theater, waitin for her turn, she looks at the mirror.  97 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s now Marina’s turn. She begins to sing with intensity conviction. Her moving voice fills the space...
